title: 'Ultimate Christmas trip' takes tourists to 8 cities for £50,000
text:
6 shares 1

A London-based tour operator is offering the ultimate Christmas trip for wealthy holidaymakers who are looking to get into the festive spirit in a way no one else has before.
Open to only one couple, the tourists who book the trip through luxury travel specialists VeryFirstTo and Hurlingham Travel will see how the rest of the world celebrates as they jet to eight destinations – for a staggering sum of £50,000 ($75,000).
In cities such as London, New York and Medellin, holidaymakers will be whisked to bustling shopping districts to buy presents for loved ones (or themselves), and take in iconic holiday displays such as Rockefeller Center’s Christmas tree.
New York's Rockefeller Center, with its iconic Christmas tree, is one of the stops on the 17-night trip
EIGHT CITIES IN 17 NIGHTS ON 'THE ULTIMATE CHRISTMAS TRIP'
London: 2 nights (Hotel Café Royal, Mandarin Oriental Hyde Park)
New York: 2 nights (Lotte New York Palace)
Orlando: 3 nights (Four Seasons)
Medellin: 2 nights (Hotel Intercontinental)
Paris: 2 nights (Hotel Fouquet’s Barriere, Hotel Plaza Athenee)
Singapore: 3 nights (Raffles Hotel)
Monaco: 1 night (Hotel de Paris)
Vienna: 2 nights (Ritz-Carlton)
Guests will holiday in the lap of luxury throughout the 17-night trip by staying in five-star hotels and flying in business class between cities.
The journey begins on 1 December in London, where the couple will be taken to the shops on Oxford Street and Regent Street.

From there the tour will take them to New York and its iconic department stores, including Macy’s and Saks Fifth Avenue, and the giant Christmas tree at Rockefeller Center in Manhattan.
By the time holidaymakers feel the chill of the December air, they will jet off to Orlando for a visit to Walt Disney World and its Christmas wonderland.
They will then travel to Medellin, Colombia, to see its Christmas Lights Fiesta, which lights up the sky with giant 3D figures.
Escaping winter's chill, guests will be flown to Orlando to take in Walt Disney World's Christmas displays
The couple will then fly back across the ocean to Paris, to shop the Marches de Noel, which is one of the busiest Christmas markets in Europe.
From there it’s on to Singapore for its annual Celebrate Christmas in Singapore event, before returning to Europe and making stops in Monte Carlo and Vienna, where they can buy holiday crafts and treats from vendors at an outdoor market.
Marcel Knobil, founder of VeryFirstTo, said: ‘This never done before tour is the ultimate Christmas experience for those who appreciate the finest and brightest decorations across the globe.
‘The lights in particular really evoke the magic of Christmas. From the iconic to the modern this trip also includes the opportunity to shop the Christmas markets of Paris and Vienna and of course, the famous stores of London, Paris and New York.’
